evidence_items.text: A tug driving instructor (tug instructor) and trainee tug driver (trainee driver) were seated beside each other in the tug. The flight crew were in communication with the headset operator via the aircraft’s interphone.
The trainee driver decided to stop the pushback and asked the tug instructor to take over.

After swapping seats the instructor recommenced the pushback, correcting the aircraft back onto the taxiway centreline. He continued to reassure and advise the trainee while performing the pushback, looking at her while doing so. The headset operator continued walking on the right side of the tug, abeam its cabin. The wingman was on the left just ahead of the tug.

The aircraft’s nosewheel reached the ‘Tug release point’ (TRP) ground markings. However, it continued moving beyond the TRP with its engine at idle and hit the blast barrier at the end of the cul-de-sac.
The tug instructor pulled the aircraft forward off the fence then stopped the tug.

slot_statements.availability: The communication/coordination breakdown among crew was present and observable during the Boeing 737-8AS 9H-QAA incident on 12-25, as recorded in the hist_dynamic_und_t1_early scope.
slot_statements.defeater_resistance: The explanation of communication/coordination breakdown among crew resists defeaters by consistently matching evidence and excluding alternative causes within the Boeing 737-8AS 9H-QAA 12-25 hist_dynamic_und_t1_early scope.
slot_statements.fit_to_key_features: The communication/coordination breakdown among crew aligns with key features of the Boeing 737-8AS 9H-QAA incident on 12-25, including timing, crew interactions, and operational context within the hist_dynamic_und_t1_early scope.

node.statement: The communication/coordination breakdown among crew was present and observable during the Boeing 737-8AS 9H-QAA incident on 12-25, as recorded in the hist_dynamic_und_t1_early scope.

assumptions: The observed behaviors and communications in the evidence reflect the overall crew coordination state during the incident.
The incident's outcome (overrunning TRP and hitting barrier) is indicative of coordination breakdown rather than solely procedural deviation or environmental causes.
defeaters: If evidence showed clear, effective communication and coordination preventing the incident, or if the incident was caused solely by procedural deviation or environmental factors without coordination failure.

quotes.exact_quote: The flight crew were in communication with the headset operator via the aircraft’s interphone.
The trainee driver decided to stop the pushback and asked the tug instructor to take over.

After swapping seats the instructor recommenced the pushback, correcting the aircraft back onto the taxiway centreline. He continued to reassure and advise the trainee while performing the pushback, looking at her while doing so.

The aircraft’s nosewheel reached the ‘Tug release point’ (TRP) ground markings. However, it continued moving beyond the TRP with its engine at idle and hit the blast barrier at the end of the cul-de-sac.
The tug instructor pulled the aircraft forward off the fence then stopped the tug.

outcome.reasoning_summary: Evidence H1-H5 shows active communication and coordination attempts among crew and tug operators, but the aircraft overrunning the TRP and hitting the blast barrier indicates a breakdown in coordination, supporting the claim of observable communication/coordination breakdown.
outcome.uncertainty_source: ambiguity in whether the continued movement beyond TRP was due to communication failure or procedural deviation

slot_statements.availability: The environmental or marking deficiency is present and observable in the Boeing 737-8AS 9H-QAA during the hist_dynamic_und_t1_early phase on 12-25.
slot_statements.defeater_resistance: The environmental or marking deficiency remains valid and is not negated by any defeaters within the Boeing 737-8AS 9H-QAA hist_dynamic_und_t1_early scenario.
slot_statements.fit_to_key_features: The identified environmental or marking deficiency aligns with the key features relevant to the Boeing 737-8AS 9H-QAA in the hist_dynamic_und_t1_early context.

node.statement: The environmental or marking deficiency is present and observable in the Boeing 737-8AS 9H-QAA during the hist_dynamic_und_t1_early phase on 12-25.

assumptions: The TRP ground markings were present and visible as no evidence suggests otherwise.
The incident was caused by procedural error rather than environmental or marking issues.
defeaters: If evidence showed the TRP markings were missing, obscured, or unclear, or if environmental conditions impaired visibility, this would support the presence of an environmental or marking deficiency.

outcome.reasoning_summary: H4 shows the aircraft passed the TRP marking and hit the barrier, indicating procedural deviation rather than an environmental or marking deficiency.
